Behold, Ponytail

This band will chirp and coo its way into your heart.

Ponytail playing live at the After the Jump Festival in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, New York 6/21/08.

Conceived as an art school project, Ponytail uses the tools of a rock band to create a unique and desperately jubilant sound that doesn't allow cumbersome things like language kill the special kind of high they're doling out. To hear them is to know what it's like to place your ears inside a grin. The hypnotic riffs of Dustin Wong and Ken Seeno (no bass here, this is a pure sugar-rush), the propulsive drumming of Jeremy Hyman, and the rapturous, delightfully uninhibited vocal stylings of Willy Siegel serve as a sonic reminder that creativity is important and that the space that falls off the page is infinite.

The short-lived band struck fire three times over their career before disbanding in 2011. Their albums Kamehameha, Ice Cream Spiritual, and Do Whatever You Want All The Time serve as ready reminders of how playful the manipulation of sound can be, and how we might benefit from not taking everything so seriously.

For more information, and to check out some outstanding live performances, explore Ponytail's tag on Pitchfork.
